UnitMaster Help Centre

How to Add a New Joint Member

Welcome to the Joint Member Registration Guide. This page walks you through each step for registering a Joint Member account in the system. Read the short instructions under every step and you will be able to complete the registration with confidence.

5 – 7 minutes to complete Best viewed on a desktop or tablet
Help > Members > New Joint Member

1 Access the "Add New Member" Page

Start by navigating to the Member Management area.

  • Log into the application with your staff username and password.
  • From the left sidebar, click Members.
  • On the Members page, click the Add a New Member button.
If you do not see the Add a New Member button, you may not have the right access. Contact your system administrator for assistance.

2 Choose the Member Type

On the first screen, you will be asked to choose what kind of member you are registering.

  • Open the Member Type dropdown list.
  • Select Joint Member.
  • Click Next to move to the personal details section.
Select Joint Member only when two individuals are sharing the same account. For single accounts, use the Single Member guide instead.

3 Fill in Primary Member Personal Details

Enter the details of the first person who will own the joint account (Primary Member).

  • Salutation (Mr, Mrs, Ms, Dr, etc)
  • First Name and Surname
  • Date of Birth
  • Gender
  • Country of Birth
  • Marital Status
Make sure names match the official ID or passport. This helps avoid issues when verifying the member later.

4 Fill in Secondary Member Personal Details

Next, capture the details of the second person on the account (Secondary Member).

  • Salutation, First Name, and Surname
  • Date of Birth and Gender
  • Country of Birth
  • Relationship to Primary Member (for example, spouse, sibling, business partner)
The Secondary Member must also meet the eligibility requirements of the fund, including age and residency rules.

5 Add Contact Details

Provide at least one reliable way to reach the joint account holders.

  • District / Town
  • Telephone Number (landline, if available)
  • Mobile Phone Number
  • Email Address
  • Physical / Postal Address
  • Preferred statement delivery method: Email or Post
It is recommended to capture a shared email address that both members can access, especially for statements and important notices.

6 Add Next of Kin Information

In case of an emergency, the Next of Kin will be used as a contact or for beneficiary updates.

  • Full Name
  • Relationship to the members
  • Phone Number
Always confirm the Next of Kin details with the members. This information should be kept up to date.

7 Statutory Details

Capture all regulatory requirements for both members.

  • Is Client Resident — Yes or No
  • Tax PIN or equivalent number
  • Income Range
  • Adverse Media Screening Done — Yes or No
Statutory details help the institution comply with KYC and AML regulations. Complete them carefully to avoid delays in approval.

8 Employment Details (If Applicable)

If either member is employed, additional sections will appear.

  • Occupation / Job Title
  • Name of Employer
  • Employer Address
For self-employed members, capture the nature of their business instead of an employer name.

9 Account Details

Link the joint members to the correct fund and commission structure.

  • Fund Name
  • Fee Category
  • Withdraw Dividends? — Yes or No
  • Agent Name (if the account was opened through an agent)
Check with your supervisor if you are not sure which fee category to apply.

10 Bank Details

You can capture bank information now or leave it for later.

  • If Yes: Enter bank name, branch, currency, account number, and account type.
  • If No: You can still proceed, but withdrawals will not be possible until bank details are added.
For joint accounts, ensure the bank account is also in joint names where required by your internal policy.

11 Complete Registration

Review all the information you have entered before saving.

  • Confirm that both members’ names and ID details are correct.
  • Check contact details, especially mobile number and email address.
  • Click Finish to submit the registration.

Any missing or incorrect fields will be highlighted in red. Correct the information and click Finish again.

After saving, you can always open the member profile later to edit or update information, depending on your user rights.

Need more help? If you get stuck at any step, contact your supervisor or the support team. Sharing a screenshot of the page will help them assist you faster.
